intro: Achyranthes uncinata, commonly known as the hookleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic with a pointed tip, and some have small hooks at the base. Achyranthes uncinata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in wet or dry conditions.
